column5: Post-consumer mixed packaging waste from various collection systems, formal and informal
column6: Paper-rich post-consumer mixed packaging waste, with and without glass, from cubside collection system often found in UK, North America, and Australia, etc.
column7: Waste collected from households, with or without separate collection system for recyclables and/or organic waste, that usually ends up at landfill, incinerator, transfer station, or even open dumps
column8: highly concentrated mono or mixed paper, collected from separate collection system or by manual or pre-sorted at MRFs, that are to be further classified and ready for paper pulper, excluding paper concetration from single stream.
column9: Plastics already collected and sorted, from separate collection system or by manual or pre-sorted at MRFs, that are to be further sorted and processed to a form of flake, fluff, and pellet ready to substitute a secondary row material or for chemical recycling
column10: Waste collected from commercial and industrial facilities and transported to treatment facilities
column11: Waste collected from construction and delomition sites and transported to treatment facilities
column12: Wood collected from the various sources including forestry, industrial and demolition wastes, domestic and bulky wastes, that are to be further sorted and cleaned and ready for wood-based panel production or energy production.
column13: Separate collected or separated textile waste from various sources including post production, post commerical and post consumer which is upgraded to feedstock for mechanical or chemical recycling
column14: all the others asssociated with wastes from households such as composting, organic cleaning (only from separate collection), Bulky waste, etc.
column15: Processing of shredded ELV's or mixed light/heavy scrap into mixed and mono fractions for secondary smelting or further treatment
column16: Production of metals by refining or remelting secondary metals
column17: Processing of electrical and electronic waste  into mixed and mono fractions for secondary smelting or further treatment
column18: all the others associated with metal sorting such as ICW (Insulated Copper Wire), IBA (Incinerator Bottom Ash), Battery Sorting, etc.
